story.synopsys: In the year 1274, a chilling conspiracy unfolds within the medieval city of Montebello. An esteemed nobleman, Lord Reginald, has been found brutally murdered in his opulent mansion, sending shockwaves through the tight-knit community. As whispers of political intrigue and secret alliances circulate through the bustling streets, tension reaches its zenith as the citizens become increasingly convinced that Lord Reginald's death is not merely a result of personal vendetta or simple greed. More and more, they suspect a deep-rooted conspiracy, carefully calculated to destabilize the fragile power structure of Montebello. As the sun sets over the towering city walls, the hunt for the truth begins, putting the brave and tenacious detective, Sir Geoffrey, against a web of treachery, hidden motives, and clandestine organizations that will go to great lengths to protect their dark secrets. Time is of the essence, for with every passing hour, the conspirators grow bolder and closer to fulfilling their sinister agenda. Only Sir Geoffrey's unwavering determination, razor-sharp intellect, and relentless pursuit of justice can unveil the truth behind the enigmatic murder of Lord Reginald and unmask the malevolent forces manipulating the fate of Montebello.

background.backstory: Arthur Hartford, a well-respected counselor, came from humble beginnings. Born into a family of artisans, he always had a keen interest in human behavior. Over the years, he gained extensive knowledge in psychology and became renowned for his ability to uncover deep-rooted secrets. Arthur's reputation led him to be the go-to person for anyone seeking guidance or assistance with their personal struggles.
background.bias: Arthur's inclination towards unmasking hidden truths often made him suspicious of others. With an unwavering belief that everyone had something to hide, he developed a strong bias towards conspiracy theories, especially those involving powerful individuals manipulating the course of history.
